text: We have examined the effect of leukotriene B4 ( LTB4 ) , a potent lipid proinflammatory mediator , on the expression of the proto-oncogenes <extra_id_0> c-jun <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> c-fos <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .

text: In addition , we looked at the modulation of nuclear factors binding specifically to the AP-1 element after LTB4 stimulation .
LTB4 increased the expression of the <extra_id_0> c-fos <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene in a time - and concentration - dependent manner .

text: The <extra_id_0> c-jun <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mRNA , which is constitutively expressed in human peripheral-blood monocytes at relatively high levels , was also slightly augmented by LTB4 , although to a much lower extent than <extra_id_0> c-fos <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .

text: The kinetics of expression of the two genes were also slightly different , with <extra_id_0> c-fos <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mRNA reaching a peak at 15 min after stimulation and <extra_id_0> c-jun <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> at 30 min .

text: Stability of the <extra_id_0> c-fos <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> c-jun <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mRNA was not affected by LTB4 , as assessed after actinomycin D treatment .

text: Nuclear transcription studies in vitro showed that LTB4 increased the transcription of the <extra_id_0> c-fos <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene 7-fold and the <extra_id_0> c-jun <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene 1.4-fold .

text: Resting monocytes contained nuclear factors binding to the AP-1 element , but stimulation of monocytes with LTB4 induced greater AP-1 - binding activity of nuclear proteins .

These results indicate that LTB4 may regulate the production of different cytokines by modulating the yield and / or the function of transcription factors such as AP-1 - binding proto-oncogene products .
